text:
e="preserve">James P. Kisicki (April 14, 1938 – November 27, 2017) was an American actor. He was born in Chicago, Illinois, but raised in Ocala, Florida. He studied at Wayne State University.
Kisicki was best known for his stage performance of "Hamlet". In 1978, Kisicki started his movie and television career appearing in the mini-series "Centennial". After that, he has appeared in movies like "The Shawshank Redemption", "Wonder Boys", and "Diabolique", among others.
Devine died at his home in Cleveland, Ohio on November 27, 2017 at the age of 79.
